author: N/A
title: The Old Testament
comments: Incredibly boring and of little value to me. Only books I'd revisit would be proverbs and Eclesiastes.

author: Marcus Aurelius
title: The meditations of Marcus Aurelius
comments: Incredible paralelisms with budism. The beauty of stoicism in understanding life, and centering yourself on what really matters. How current this book is, and how sad that is with regards to the evolution of humanity's understanding of life.

author: David Kahneman
title: Thinking Fast and Slow
comments: Super-interesting. Most widely applicable being part 1. A bit slow on the reading as its dense and longwinded, but worth every bit of information.

author: Teresa de Avila
title: Camino de Perfección
comments: Un poco redicho y antiguo el lenguaje. Pero muy interesante, ver cómo lideraba Sta Teresa, y cómo se parece a la meditación. La importancia de la humildad, y su lectura del Padre Nuestro.

author: Sharon L. Bowman
title: Training from the back of the room
Deliberate Calm - How to lead and learn in a volatile world

author: Paul Auster
comments: Precioso libro, magistralmente escrito, con el marco de la américa (NY) de los años 60, 70, 80. Una maravilla para disfrutar.

author: Homer
title: La Iliada
comments: A must read, second time around.

author: Homer
title: La Odisea
comments: A must read, second time around.

author: Joseph Heller
title: Catch22
comments: Beautiful book, starts hilarious and non-sensical, and starts showing the drama of war, its effect on people, and the desertion of the state to its soldiers.

author: Ernest Hemingway
title: For whom the bell tolls
comments: Beautifully writen, also a good look into our recen Spanish history. The senseless war, brutality, love, and beautiful narration.

author: Dante Allighieri
title: La divina comedia
comments: Es realmente sorprendente cómo está hecho, y los temas que toca así como la forma de abordarlos. Sin embargo sin ser un gran conocedor de la historia del renacimiento italiano ni un gran conocedor de teología cristiana, se hace un poco árido. También pierde claramente con las traducciones.

author: Yuval Noah Harari
title: Sapiens: A brief history of humankind
comments: Explora hipotesis de las razones detrás de los mayores cambios en la historia de la humanidad. Cómo las construcciones mentales han sido el centro que ha permitido a la humanidad crear agrupaciones cada vez mayores, dentro de estos constructos, la religión, el capitalismo, la ciencia y su interrelación.

author: Jared Diamond
title: Why sex is fun? The evolution of human sexuality

author: Jared Diamon
title: Guns, Germs and Steel: The fate of human societies

author: Seneca
title: El libro de Oro
comments: Libro que recoge muchas frases cortas de la sabiduría de Seneca. Mucho para aprovechar.

author: Michael Wisehart
title: Aldoran Chronicles 3 - The 4 part key
comments: Dejo la serie es demasiado infantil.

author: James Clear
title: Atomic Habits - Tiny Changes for Remarkable Results

author: Jose Luis Corral
title: Independencia
comments: Libro interesantillo por lo que toca la historia de Zaragoza, pero póbremente escrito con muy muy poco gancho

author: Jidu Krishnamurti
title: Descubrir lo Inmensurable (Talks in Germany)
comments: Very nice book on the observations of JK, how to move from the known and what is needed to be able to perceive what there is of "godlike" or Religious in us. A process of observation, and freedom from conditioning external and internal.
